result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey J Manley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation>$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Concurrent with: *Probation sentence to be concurrent.
*Probation sentence, confinement and condition time may be served in Wood County.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so).
*Court advises the Defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible.

*AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
*Random screens.

timeConds.notes: *Serve 30 days in the Milwaukee County Jail with release privileges for employment and counseling.  Court will neither grant or oppose electronic monitoring - Wood County and Milwaukee County may make that determination.  Condition time to commence no later than April 1, 2016.

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Conviction Amended that the language "no good time" should be removed from the imposed and stayed sentence on Count 2
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 10, calendar successor, for review. spc

Defendant's pro se request for good time credit.  

(Return address: Jeff Manley, 1402 E. Royalton Street, Waupaca, WI 54981).

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant.
Letter from defendant.
Letter to defendant
Defendant's pro se request for reconsideration.
-Denying Motion To Modify Sentence; Received, filed and signed by the Court on March 23, 2017. Copies distributed to parties.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, calendar successor, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se motion to modify sentence.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by Cheryl M.,the State, defense counsel and defendant.

As to Count 2:
Court sentenced defendant to serve  1  year in the Milwaukee County Jail, straight time, no good time credit to be earned.

Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for  2 years with the following conditions:
Probation sentence to be concurrent.
Probation sentence, confinement and condition time may be served in Wood County.

- Serve 30 days in the Milwaukee County Jail with release privileges for employment and counseling.  Court will neither grant or oppose electronic monitoring - Wood County and Milwaukee County may make that determination.  Condition time to commence no later than April 1, 2016.
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Random screens
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  Full-time employment
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Provide a DNA sample (if not already done so)

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Jeffrey J Manley in court with Attorney Eric Sheets.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 2:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

As to Count  1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count  1   DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms  and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Jury trial is vacated.

Attorney James T Moczydlowski in court, defendant Jeffrey J Manley not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to modifiy Justice Point supervision heard.  Defendant in custody in another county and will be on extended supervision once his sentence is served in December.  Defendant will be residing in Wisconsin Rapids and monitoring will cause undue travel hardship.  Court modifies bail to remove Justice Point monitoring.  Matter to remain calendared for final pretrial.

Attorney James T Moczydlowski in court, defendant Jeffrey J Manley not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requested more time as the preliminary hearing was on 06/19/2015.  The state requested the case be aligned with the co-defendant on 07/17/2015. Case remains calendared in Branch 21. Defendant Jeffrey J Manley in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Jeffrey J Manley in custody.  Ronald Dague for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Brian Murphy-Village of West Milwaukee Police Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in custody in Waupaca County Jail not produced for today's proceedings.  State did have an officer present for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jeffrey J Manley in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Jeffrey J Manley in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm

Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
